intro: Pitaviaster, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Pitaviaster is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
